channel.title: LOTR Online is now free to play (Pictures)
channel.description:
This actually looks like a very nice game. Its been a p2p since 2007 but recently became free (but not as a last ditch effort like dnd)
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lpBu9DUuAyw
http://www.lotro.com/
[img]http://content.turbine.com/sites/www.lotro.com/f2p/images/locations/shire/shot_1_full.jpg[/img]
[img]http://content.turbine.com/sites/www.lotro.com/f2p/images/locations/shire/shot_2_full.jpg[/img]
[img]http://content.turbine.com/sites/www.lotro.com/f2p/images/locations/shire/shot_4_full.jpg[/img]
[img]http://content.turbine.com/sites/www.lotro.com/f2p/images/locations/shire/shot_5_full.jpg[/img]
[img]http://kittenslitter.files.wordpress.com/2007/02/lotro-wildlife.jpg[/img]
[img]http://www.blogcdn.com/www.massively.com/media/2008/03/os50_lotro_fullsize.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/2149/screenshot00045co0.jpg[/img]
Its almost like an oblivion online. But as soon as i feel like waiting 15 hrs for the download ill try it out.

item.title: LOTR Online is now free to play (Pictures)
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:7, topic:361951”][quote author=Frell link=topic=458227.msg3353107#msg3353107 date=1285531733]

Isnt worth the effort as

  1. It basically says “FUCK YOU” to the lore and lacks immersion
  2. The free to play is a scam as it’s impossible to play decently with the ridiculous limits imposed on the player

(I played this from release for about 3 months, so i’m not talking out of my ass)

I havent played it, you’re saying the free to play is limited like RS f2p?
[/quote]RS f2p barely has any limits, Jagex are very generous with that. Check out the limitations to LOTRO and you’ll cry[/quote]
Not even worth trying then. I thought the entire game became free on September 10th, i havent heard anything about it being limited.

You’re right… wow… http://pc.ign.com/articles/111/1119658p1.html

Second paragraph starts the shitstorm

Read full topic

hahaha[/quote]
?

They were both by the same company, but DND wasnt very popular so it became free. Apparently LOTR has had a pretty active player base for the past 3 years.
